title: Mame89
author: Mame89
content: Sumber gambar :  media.bareksa.comIn this thread, I want to discuss the story of a country that for the last 100 years has succeeded in becoming the largest economic power in the world, especially if it's not the United States. even though about 150 to 200 years ago the American economy was nothing when compared to, for example, the British Empire, the Chinese empire and also the kingdoms in Hindustan, but only in a short time, the current American country could become a giant power in proportion to GDP (Gross Domestic Product). reached 24% of all GDP in the world.right now even if for example compared to other countries, America is 20 times larger than the GDP of other countries, even the number of financial assets in America in 2021 then covers 28% of all financial assets in the world. in the same year, now entering America's natural wealth, it has the second largest natural resource in the world with a value of 45 trillion dollars which includes coal, natural gas, copper, gold, wood and many more specifically with gold America has the largest gold reserves in the world. world today, namely 8,133 tons. this gold reserve of America's wealth does not include its vocal vocal industry like Hollywood and also the music industry and also the technological empire that almost monopolizes access to information technology around the world.So the question now is why did America become such a big economic power? even though if we look at the history of America 100 to 200 years ago it was just a nomadic colony which was a runaway from the Europeans so at the beginning of their independence in 1776 the American people were still very far from the word prosperous, most people in America needed to fight to fight against the ferocity nature and winter even fought against the local population to be able to survive everyday with a GDP that was only 2% of the world's GDP at that time. The United States is by no means considered a force to be reckoned with. My question is what are the factors that make the United States the largest economy in the world?

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: If I had to guess with the knowledge I have about the United States today. I would say it is a collection of things which allowed that country to reach a big status in the international stage: emphasis in technological development, a strong military culture, attracting the brightest minds to live there and work for them (Einstein and the Scientist of the project Paperclip being the most famous examples). The military position together with the technological advantage can help to further boost their economy. I believe the rise of USA accelerated a bit after the fall of the Soviet Union, but I am not sure. It would make sense though, since USA stayed has the only superpower for a long time, being only China the most recent foe in that aspect.

comments.author: coupable
comments.body: Since you dealt with the subject from a historical aspect, I can say that one of the most important pillars of American economic power is the First and Second World Wars, which destroyed the classical powers and contributed to the emergence of new empires. The First World War took place between the world's largest powers in a competition to redivide the world. America was not a direct party to the conflict, and it used to benefit from financing the warring parties, whether with weapons or supplies. And after the collapse of giant entities in 2018 (the end of the war), new powers appeared on the scene, such as America, which did not have any losses (economic and military superiority), while even the victorious countries relied mainly on direct support from colonies in Africa and the East. . It was World War II that greatly supported America's position in the world as an economic power after joining the Allies and declaring the terrifying nuclear weapon in the face of the world (not just Japan) to put an end to the war and establish the dominance of the dollar in Bretton-wood. Since that time, America has been the world leader on several levels before China ascended a few years ago, 20-30 years ago.

comments.author: YUriy1991
comments.body: Why like this, because America has a unique economic system that encourages innovation and entrepreneurship and has a strong legal framework that protects property, contracts and intellectual property rights. This legal system creates a stable and predictable environment for businesses to operate, which encourages investment and growth and most importantly the United States has a large and diverse population that provides a broad market for goods and services. This allows American businesses to grow quickly and effectively, both domestically and internationally. These factors have enabled the United States to create and innovate, and drive economic growth and the prosperity of its people.

comments.author: MArsland
comments.body: Quote from: Mame89 on April 18, 2023, 03:22:03 PMMy question is what are the factors that make the United States the largest economy in the world?This can be answered when we flash back to World War 2 where the US was the main pillar behind the end of World War 2. If you have ever heard of the Bretton Wood agreement, you must know that the contents of the agreement were the US that changed the gold standard to US Dollars. Furthermore, after the end of World War 2 when other countries experienced enormous losses, the US stood as a country that provided loans. From that step, the US had begun to dominate the economy of each country because of debt in the form of Dollars and Gold, which the US did have a large supply of.And from borrowing funds to restore the country's economy due to World War 2, the role of the US does not end there because as a country that has natural resources, controlled infrastructure management, as well as imports and exports of goods will return to the US. Simply put, you are the owner of the money and the car manufacturer, and then loan money to a friend to buy a car in your own shop. Isn't it profitable besides the profit from selling your car, you also have the profit from the loan.That was the picture of the US at that time and until now such a system is still continuing.

Resources allowed to raise the industry. The presence of BRAIN who came to America from high-tech Europe of those times. And by the end of the 19th century, the "new world" became attractive for everyone who wanted to realize themselves and become what they could not become in the "old world". Very smart, I would even say cunning, financial policy, historical events - also helped the United States to take its place. There was actually one civil war in the USA, after which peace was fixed for centuries. Plus, quite adequate neighbors from the north and south and geographical remoteness for enemies ....

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: There are a lot of reasons why the US can retain its status as the biggest economy in the world. They may lack the capability and capacity to mass produce goods like what China is doing, but their foothold on a lot of major economies and investments in a lot of countries proves that they can just outsource the labor and the material and they will still gain a lot. Great example is Apple outsourcing the manufacturing and materials to China, and still getting valued at over $2 trillion dollars. Also, a lot of countries are still putting a premium on US products, and there's that. They project their image as a country that produces great products, when in fact they rarely make them in their homeland. This projection is getting bought by other countries which, in turn, gets their goods prioritized over any other products from other countries.
